creator: oliver.henning@aloba.ch
text:
The Jikes Compiler up to the current Version 1.17 does not understand the
commandline switch '-encoding' on Windows Platform. So ANT should not
give him this Option, when running under Windows.

An advantage would be, that one could use Jikes for JSP Compilation with Tomcat 
4.1, as his JSP Engine Jasper uses ANT.

Greetings,

Oliver Henning
aloba AG

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
jikes supports the encoding option, depending on how it is compiled.  I'm don't
whether the Windows version will never be compiled with the correct libraries,
but in general jikes can support that option.

If you don't want the encoding attribute, don't specify it.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 4230 ***
